Package com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleWriteTransaction

  • java.lang.Object

extends BleTransaction.Ota

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  BleWriteTransaction.FailListener
      Interface for handling failures when writing.
      static interface  BleWriteTransaction.WriteQueueListener
      Interface for listening between each write made in the queue.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BleWriteTransaction()
      Use this constructor if you don't plan on setting a BleWriteTransaction.FailListener to listen for write fails in the queue.
      BleWriteTransaction​(BleWriteTransaction.FailListener failListener)
      Overload of BleWriteTransaction(WriteQueueListener, FailListener).
      BleWriteTransaction​(BleWriteTransaction.WriteQueueListener writeListener, BleWriteTransaction.FailListener failListener)
      Instantiate a new BleWriteTransaction with a BleWriteTransaction.WriteQueueListener, which allows you to perform operations between each write in the queue, and a BleWriteTransaction.FailListener to tell the Transaction what to do on a write failure.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BleWriteTransaction

        public BleWriteTransaction()
        Use this constructor if you don't plan on setting a BleWriteTransaction.FailListener to listen for write fails in the queue. The transaction will abort if any writes fail.

      • BleWriteTransaction

        public BleWriteTransaction​(BleWriteTransaction.FailListener failListener)
        Overload of BleWriteTransaction(WriteQueueListener, FailListener). Instantiate a new BleWriteTransaction with a BleWriteTransaction.FailListener to tell the transaction how to proceed on write fails.

      • BleWriteTransaction

        public BleWriteTransaction​(BleWriteTransaction.WriteQueueListener writeListener,
                           BleWriteTransaction.FailListener failListener)
        Instantiate a new BleWriteTransaction with a BleWriteTransaction.WriteQueueListener, which allows you to perform operations between each write in the queue, and a BleWriteTransaction.FailListener to tell the Transaction what to do on a write failure.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        protected void start()
        Starts the transaction. If you override this method, be sure to call super.start(), so the writes are actually performed.
        Specified by:
        start in class BleTransaction

      • add

        public BleWriteTransaction add​(BleWrite write)
        Add an BleWrite to the write queue. You can chain this method, to make it easier to add multiple writes.

      • addAll

        public BleWriteTransaction addAll​(java.util.Collection<BleWrite> writes)
        Add a Collection of writes to the write queue.

      • add

        public BleWriteTransaction add​(java.util.UUID charUuid,
                               byte[] data)
        Add a write to the write queue. You can chain this method, to make it easier to add multiple writes.

      • add

        public BleWriteTransaction add​(java.util.UUID serviceUuid,
                               java.util.UUID charUuid,
                               byte[] data)
        Add a write to the write queue. You can chain this method, to make it easier to add multiple writes.

      • remaining

        public int remaining()
        Returns how many write operations are left in the queue.
